Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to generate a prompt for a target LLM that encourages it to identify anomalies and undesirable behaviors in the given event log hypothesize why these anomalies might occur and propose relevant SQL queries to investigate these hypotheses further We need to output a prompt that will be given to the target LLM So we need to craft a user message that describes the scenario includes the data and asks the LLM to do these things

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We have underlying database and schema plus sample data The prompt should be presented in a way that instructs the LLM to act as an analyst reviewing the event log data provided and other tables It should identify anomalies deviations from the normal process flow and hypothesize reasons then propose SQL queries to investigate

Name: Validation - PE
Text: We need to avoid giving any hints or guidance beyond whats in the prompt the prompt should be self-contained We must also consider that the target LLM may be an evaluation model But we are constructing a prompt as if we are the user asking the AI to analyze the data Thus we need to craft a comprehensive prompt with the following elements Background The order process flow normal flow Register Order Perform Credit Check Validate Stock Confirm Shipment Ship Goods Issue Invoice Receive Payment The order_event_log table with sample rows The orders and resources tables with sample data Instruction Identify any anomalies and undesirable behaviors in the given event log Hypothesize why these anomalies might occur Propose relevant SQL queries to investigate these hypotheses further

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Given the data there are obvious anomalies cases where activities occur out of order missing activities extra activities timing issues etc For example Case 1002 Confirm Shipment and Ship Goods before Credit Check and Validate Stock Case 1003 Ship Goods before Confirm Shipment and after Credit Check but Validate Stock missing Actually Validate Stock not present also Confirm Shipment after Ship Goods and after Issue Invoice Case 1004 Receive Payment before Invoice Actually Receive Payment occurs before Issue Invoice and before Confirm Shipment Ship Goods That is odd also missing Credit Check and Validate Stock Also Ship Goods and Confirm Shipment appear after

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: That suggests a possible policy violation shipping before credit check That might indicate missing Validate Stock and out-of-order Confirm We can also hypothesize about resource assignments different roles performing activities not appropriate But resources seem consistent per role department However we can see that FinanceTeam 02 is a Cashier and receives payment which is okay but in case 1004 Receive Payment is before Invoice which might be a prepayment Thus the anomalies are interesting

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The LLM should generate hypotheses Credit check bypassed for some orders Shipment confirmed or shipped before stock validation Invoices issued after payment Possible data entry errors System or process deviations for priority orders etc Then propose SQL queries to investigate count missing activities per case check ordering constraints examine timing between events join with orders to see if order_type influences anomalies join with resources to see if certain departments roles perform activities out of sequence

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: The prompt should be concise but include necessary data Since the data is provided as markdown tables we can include them directly But the instruction says The target model should be encouraged to Identify anomalies Hypothesize why Propose relevant SQL queries without any hints or guidance provided here So we need to encourage it to do that not necessarily ask for no extra explanation But we can structure the prompt accordingly We need to ensure the prompt includes all data Well copy the given tables exactly Lets produce the final prompt
